item.title: Up to 100,000 dead fish found on bank of Lake Menindee
item.description: Residents of a far west New South Wales community found tens of thousands of dead fish on the banks of Lake Menindee.

item.title: Defence Department announces plans to sell off Leeuwin and Irwin Barracks in Perth
item.description: The Department of Defence announces plans to sell off both Leeuwin and Irwin barracks, freeing up dozens of hectares of residential land in prime Perth suburbs.

item.title: Demons defender Steven May misses AFL pre-season training
item.description: Melbourne Demons veteran Steven May was not at training for his club on Wednesday, just six weeks out from the start of the 2026 AFL season.

item.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson
item.description: From Aussie expat Ron Mueck's hyper-realistic sculptures and Icelandic Danish artist Olafur Eliasson's thought-provoking installations to the best contemporary artists in Tasmania, here are three exhibitions to see.

item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
item.description: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: Queensland to expand to adult crime, adult time laws for a second time
item.description: Queensland's tough youth crime laws will be expanded for a second time, but the government won't reveal which new offences will be included.

item.title: Melinda Gates reacts to allegations against ex-husband Bill Gates in new Epstein files
item.description: Melinda French Gates says her ex-husband, Bill Gates, needs to answer for his behaviour alleged in the latest batch of Epstein files.

item.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

item.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
item.description: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

item.title: Police condemn dozens of e-bike riders for Sydney Harbour Bridge stunt
item.description: Police are combing over CCTV of Tuesday's stunt where officers believe several offences were committed.

item.title: Northern Territory mum wrangles Humpty Doo crocodile near Arnhem Highway
item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.title: Humpty Doo locals help relocate crocodile from side of highway
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Banned tennis player Thomas Fancutt makes comeback after IV vitamin breach
item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.title: Why these women took marriage sabbaticals — and how it went
item.description: Do you ever feel like taking a break from your marriage? Three women share how a marriage sabbatical changed their relationship.

item.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
item.description: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

item.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show
item.description: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

item.title: World's fastest falcon spotted in Central Australian outback for the first time
item.description: The world's fastest falcon has been spotted in Central Australia for the first time, surprising even the seasoned birdwatcher who caught the rare sight on camera.

item.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
item.description: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: FOI documents reveal how Anika Wells's New York trip costs escalated
item.description: The final New York travel bill for Communications Minister Anika Wells and her staffer rose $7,000 from an initial booking due to last-minute changes.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Austin Appelbee's incredible tale of survival has made international headlines. How did the 13yo do it?
item.description: Austin Appelbee, 13, has made international headlines after swimming for four hours in rough seas to save his mum, sister and brother stranded in the ocean. How did he do it?

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Labor MP Ed Husic 'uncomfortable' with Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit
item.description: Labor's Ed Husic says it is "hard to reconcile" a visit by Israeli President Isaac Herzog with comments he has made in relation to the war in Gaza.

item.title: Hopes fading for a Coalition reconciliation
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: What is India’s Nipah virus and should Australians be worried?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Bill Gates denies allegations in new Epstein files release
item.description: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates denies ever visiting Jeffrey Epstein's private island after new claims surfaced following the release of files from a US government investigation into the late sex offender.

item.title: Capital gains tax reform among options as Labor weighs housing pitch
item.description: After Jim Chalmers repeatedly refused to rule out changing the capital gains tax discount, a government source told the ABC that changes related to housing were being considered, with capital gains not ruled out.

item.title: At least 162 dead, local king missing after gunmen storm Nigerian village
item.description: Government authorities are blaming "terrorist cells" for the violence in Africa's most populous country.

item.title: Marius Borg Høiby, son of Norwegian crown princess, denies rape charges in testimony
item.description: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

item.title: Trump administration pulls 700 immigration officers out of Minnesota
item.description: The administration's border tsar says the decision came after local and state authorities agreed to cooperate more closely with its immigration crackdown.

item.title: Winter Olympics quiz: How well are you prepared for the Games?
item.description: The Winter Olympics gets underway in Milan Cortina this week — but how much do you know about the Winter Olympics? Test yourself in our fiendish quiz.

item.title: 'Bloodbath' at Washington Post as massive layoffs announced
item.description: The Jeff Bezos-owned paper, which famously brought down US President Richard Nixon, will drastically cut back in size and lay off workers in all its departments.

item.title: A 'ghost airport' and sinkhole highway as Timor-Leste gambles on oil and gas with Greater Sunrise project
item.description: The Greater Sunrise gas project was meant to transform Timor-Leste and bring billions in revenue, but locals are still waiting for the jobs and opportunities that were promised.

item.title: Attorney-General asked anti-corruption chief to explain himself after Defence ties emerged
item.description: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland asked Paul Brereton to explain why his ongoing ties to Defence had not been "adequately" disclosed in a letter sent last year.

item.title: Online safety watchdog says tech giants failing to detect child abuse
item.description: Major tech companies including Apple, Google, Meta and Microsoft are still failing to do enough to detect and stop child sexual abuse, eSafety has claimed.

item.title: Report points to exploitation, Medicare and visa concerns in Pacific islander jobs scheme
item.description: Changing jobs is a basic right for most people, but it is not so simple for Pacific Australia Labour Mobility workers.

item.title: In Zak Hilditch's horror movie We Bury the Dead, the zombie apocalypse devastates Tasmania
item.description: These Final Hours writer and director Zak Hilditch drew on personal tragedy to produce We Bury the Dead, his biggest cinematic epic yet.

item.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
item.description: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

item.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
item.description: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Mother shares concerns about treatment at Toowoomba Hospital amid culture review
item.description: A confrontation caught on body-worn security footage in the halls of the Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit highlights concerns raised by local mothers.

item.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature
item.description: Parramatta's next generation of outside backs must step up if they are to fill the void left by Zac Lomax, his ex-teammate Josh Addo-Carr has said.

item.title: 'Ironic' and 'lazy' AI-generated images shared on Queensland government department social media accounts
item.description: A Queensland government department has urged social media users not to trust AI through the use of an AI-generated image.

item.title: Two months since the social media ban began and teens say it isn't working
item.description: Australia's world-first social media ban for under-16s is two months old, but teenagers say they have found ways around it.

item.title: What are data centres and what do they mean for regional Victoria?
item.description: With the announcement of two new facilities outside of Melbourne, could regional Victoria become a hotspot for data centres?

item.title: What is the difference between a tropical low and cyclone in northern Australia?
item.description: Tropical lows are weaker than tropical cyclones, but a meteorologist explains they can still cause significant damage.

item.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases
item.description: There were 55 water releases from the region's coal mines in the month of January into the largest catchment draining to the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Homeless Whitsunday boaties begin long rebuild after Tropical Cyclone Koji carnage
item.description: Around a dozen boats recovered by Marine Safety Queensland were part-time or permanent liveaboard boats, with boaties in the Whitsundays facing a long journey to find a new permanent home on or off the water.

item.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
item.description: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

item.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
item.description: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

item.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
item.description: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

item.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
item.description: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

item.title: How Super Bowl-bound Aussie Michael Dickson became NFL's best punter
item.description: Michael Dickson has become one of the finest punters in the NFL, and could become just the second Australian to play in a victorious Super Bowl team.

item.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
item.description: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

item.title: CIA says it will cease publishing the World Factbook, a free online resource used by millions
item.description: A statement on the CIA's website gives no reason for the decision, simply stating that the Factbook has been "sunset" while encouraging readers to "stay curious about the world and find ways to explore it".

item.title: Australians in Japan say ski fields are safe after spate of deaths
item.description: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

item.title: State of Origin 2027 in New Zealand hailed as a boost for rugby league by Kiwi great
item.description: The NRL's reported landmark move to host a State of Origin match in New Zealand is hailed as "sensational" by Kiwi legend Gary Freeman.

item.title: Invasion Day bomb declared terror act, as accused's 'pro-white ideology' probed
item.description: The attempted bombing of an Invasion Day rally in Perth's CBD last week is declared a terrorist attack by authorities.

item.title: Strict caps on bottled water extraction urged for World Heritage-listed Springbrook
item.description: A long-awaited study warns that the extraction of bottled water from the World Heritage-listed Springbrook area poses a potential risk to the ancient Gondwana rainforests and should be strictly limited.

item.title: Private health insurers take aim at rising specialists fees
item.description: A survey of 4,000 patients finds more than half had an unexpected cost when under a specialist's care.

item.title: AFL integrity unit looking into why police visited Melbourne Demons player Steven May
item.description: Melbourne veteran Steven May is being investigated by the AFL integrity unit, as the premiership defender stays away from Demons training.

item.title: ACTU pushing 'above-inflation' wage increase in 2026 as real paypackets decline
item.description: Australia's biggest employers are under pressure to give their workers pay increases above 4 per cent this year, as real wages go backwards and the union movement ramps up pressure.

item.title: Families respond after Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings released
item.description: Loved ones of victims Ashlee Good and Jade Young have fought back tears responding to findings from the high-profile inquest into the Westfield Bondi Junction stabbing.

item.title: Mother of autistic children shares experience in wake of suspected double murder-suicide
item.description: A mother of two autistic children living in regional Western Australia has shared her experience of navigating bureaucracy while caring for children with complex needs.

item.title: Old Spirit ferries up sale with new berth 'on track' for October launch, TT-Line says
item.description: Ferry operator TT-Line is confident its two new Spirit of Tasmania vessels will begin operating by October — but it says there is a "risk" its existing ships might not be sold by then.

item.title: Bunnings wins fight to use AI facial recognition tech to combat store crime, opening door for other retailers
item.description: Bunnings was reasonably entitled to use AI facial recognition technology to combat crime and staff abuse in its stores, the Administrative Review Tribunal finds.

item.title: Murray-Darling Basin Authority hands down discussion paper ahead of first review in 14 years
item.description: The Murray-Darling Basin Authority says the basin plan has delivered real benefits, but climate change, disconnected floodplains and poor water quality mean things still need to change.

item.title: NSW government contacts Newcastle Writers Festival about author Randa Abdel-Fattah's inclusion
item.description: The NSW government makes contact with the board of next month's Newcastle Writers Festival about the inclusion of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah, the ABC understands.

item.title: Democrat victory in Republican stronghold could spell trouble for Trump
item.description: The US has been gripped by cold weather in recent weeks, but pundits say it is in Texas where hell has truly frozen over. A blue wave just swept a GOP stronghold, and Republicans are very worried.

item.title: What will happen to the land from the sale of Perth's Irwin and Leeuwin barracks, and where will the money go?
item.description: The planned sale of the Irwin and Leeuwin barracks in Perth will see dozens of hectares of potentially prime residential land hit the market. So is it likely to be used for housing, and what difference will it really make?

item.title: Union urges Sanjeev Gupta to sell Tahmoor mine as $350m offer revealed
item.description: The Mining and Energy Union says a firm $350 million offer is on the table to restart Tahmoor Colliery, warning delays risk the mine's future and hundreds of jobs.

item.title: Coroner recommends Ambulance Victoria guideline review following nut allergy death of Max McKenzie
item.description: The coroner could not definitively rule that the anaphylaxis death of 15-year-old Max McKenzie was preventable, despite identifying delays in the teen's medical treatment.

item.title: Shadow arts minister calls for Mardi Gras funding review, accuses board of infiltration
item.description: The cancellation of the LGBTQIA+ parade's afterparty has escalated to the NSW parliament, with the Pride in Protest group being accused of threatening the viability of the event.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Bondi Junction inquest saw recommendation for supported housing for homeless, some are already benefitting
item.description: An inquest into the Bondi Junction stabbing has recommended that the NSW government support long-term accommodation for homeless people experiencing mental health issues. It's a model that is already finding success.

item.title: NT politicians walk out of parliament to protest administrator's appointment
item.description: Seven members of the Northern Territory parliament have walked out of Question Time over the appointment of the next administrator, David Connolly.

item.title: New study reveals how stressful footy fandom can be
item.description: A new study reveals how much high-stakes sporting events can get the heart pumping by strapping trackers to over 200 German football fans.

item.title: Russia and Ukraine conduct POW swap after latest US-led peace talks
item.description: The Kremlin says it sees progress and positive movement in the talks, brokered by the United States, as Donald Trump urges both sides to reach a peace deal.

item.title: Valentino Guseli gets snowboard big air wildcard, leaps into final at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Valentino Guseli only found out he had been added to the big air field a couple of hours before the competition start after a rival's injury, but still found a way to make it to the final.

item.title: Positive spin from Liberal leader as retiring MP Sam Groth forces Nepean by-election
item.description: When retiring first-term Liberal Sam Groth told his leader he was quitting politics, forcing a by-election, Jess Wilson didn't try to talk him out of it.

item.title: Today in history, February 6: The Manchester United team that perished in the Munich air disaster of 1958
item.description: On a snowy February afternoon in 1958, the football team that many were calling the greatest that Britain had ever produced stopped to refuel at Munich Airport. The plane would never take off, and the Flowers of Manchester would take years to bloom again.

item.title: Jim Chalmers's appetite for economic reform is about to be tested
item.description: Jim Chalmers could face his biggest test yet as treasurer over the next few months.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: When does it start, how to watch and who is competing in which sports
item.description: Australia is tipped for enormous success over the next couple of weeks so now might be a good time to clue yourself up. Here's everything you need to know about the 2026 Winter Games.

item.title: An ex-jihadi and terror experts agree on one thing about extremism
item.description: As police probe what led to the deadliest terror attack on Australian soil in December, radicalisation researchers and a former Islamic State group supporter have shed light on how people are recruited.

item.title: World Anti-Doping Agency bosses 'will look at' claims of penis enlargement in ski jumping
item.description: The World Anti-Doping Agency will investigate bizarre claims in German newspaper Bild that ski jumpers are injecting substances into their penises to aid aerodynamics — and other stories from the Winter Olympics a day out from the opening ceremony.

item.title: State coroner recommends NSW government adopt Escape. Hide. Tell awareness campaign
item.description: The recommendation was one of 23 handed down on Thursday as part of the Bondi Junction stabbing inquest findings.

item.title: What Israel's President Isaac Herzog has said about Gaza, and why he won't be arrested in Australia
item.description: When Israel's president lands in Australia this weekend, he can expect an official red carpet treatment. But he will be all too aware of the controversy his visit is generating.

item.title: Karnivool's new album In Verses was worth the 13-year wait, bagpipes and all
item.description: They're one of Australia's most revered heavy acts. And arguably the most patient. Karnivool unpack the 13-year journey to their new album, In Verses.

item.title: Late NSW tradie Brett Mckay connected with thousands by sharing cancer battle online
item.description: When NSW tradie Brett Mckay started sharing videos of his cancer journey with his mates on social media, he did not expect thousands of strangers to come along for the ride.

item.description: The first regular-season NFL match played on Australian shores has been confirmed as a clash between division rivals.

item.description: As One Nation announces its plan to open an office in Longreach, the ABC speaks to voters in David Littleproud's electorate to get their thoughts on the Nationals leader.

item.title: ASX suffers worst day in almost a year in 'panic' sell-off — as it happened
item.description: Nearly $70 billion has been wiped off the Australian share market in its worst trading session since the "Liberation Day" sell-off in April 2025. See how the day unfolded and read insights from our business reporters on the ABC News markets blog.

item.description: The Nationals have proposed spending another two weeks in exile from the frontbench rather than address the Liberals' non-negotiable conditions for a Coalition reunion.

item.description: Royal Challengers Bengaluru pulled off the biggest successful chase in the Women's Premier League to win their second title in the Indian franchise-based T20 league.

item.title: Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis defends controversial Perth and WA demersal fishing ban
item.description: A "judgement call" about a permanent commercial fishing ban for demersal species went further than the advice handed to her, WA's Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis says.

item.description: Premier Roger Cook writes to the 13-year-old, who made international headlines after swimming 4 kilometres in rough seas to raise the alarm and save his family.

item.title: Pharmacy apologises after customers given wrong medicines, scripts in Broome
item.description: More than a dozen customers have come forward over concerns two Broome chemists have handed out the wrong medications.

item.description: The former prime minister said it should not be for judges to decide when a political protest was justified, which are remarks NSW's top judge called "regrettable".

item.description: A Queensland not-for-profit mental health clinic that delivers novel therapies such as ketamine and psilocybin is expanding its services.

item.description: The two-time winner of Australia's Best Takeaway Fish and Chips says it has been forced to increase prices considerably following Western Australia's demersal fishing reforms.

item.description: Queensland Jewish Board of Deputies president Jason Steinberg has called on the state government to ramp up anti-hate laws in the wake of last year's Bondi terror attack.

item.description: The man accused of a one-punch attack on former Labor strategist Tim Picton, who died in hospital last month, has his charge upgraded to manslaughter.

item.title: Premier Chris Minns says Newcastle Writers Festival 'crazy' to invite author Randa Abdel-Fattah
item.description: The festival's director said Dr Abdel-Fattah was invited in August last year and denied the state government pressured her to remove the writer.

item.title: WA author Craig Silvey has child exploitation bail conditions altered after complaining of media attention
item.description: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

item.description: The program — which will run from March to September — will provide free flu vaccinations, including a nasal spray option for children aged two to five years.

item.title: RecipeTin Eats' Nagi Maehashi is normalising taking time off for pets. Here's why that matters.
item.description: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

item.title: Bullock says government spending not sole factor pushing inflation higher as political fight heats up
item.description: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

item.description: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

item.title: Why it took police nine days to declare the Invasion Day attempted bomb attack in Perth terrorism
item.description: When a homemade fragment bomb was allegedly thrown into a crowd on January 26, it took nine days for it to be declared an act of terrorism. The WA police commissioner explains why, as Indigenous leaders raise concerns.

item.title: TC Mitchell set to become severe category 3 system off WA's Pilbara coast
item.description: Residents along WA's Pilbara coast have been warned to prepare to shelter as Cyclone Mitchell builds into a severe category 3 system.

item.title: Daisy Thomas, competing without an ACL, suffers heavy crash at Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.title: US accuses China of secret nuclear testing as Washington calls for Beijing to be part of new arms deal
item.description: The claim comes as the US calls for China to be involved in a new deal limiting the use of nuclear weapons, after the New START deal expired this week.

item.title: Albanese's invitation to Herzog is a shift in his approach to Israel
item.description: Unravelling the threads of antisemitism and anti-Israeli sentiment will require both more political courage and more community tolerance than we have seen to date.

item.title: Budget reform is back as Labor shapes second term agenda
item.description: As the opposition and government wrestled in the hay barn over who's to blame for this week's Reserve Bank interest rate increase, there's a much bigger story unfolding in the wings.

item.title: 'Another world is possible': Calls for unity at Winter Olympics opening

item.title: Adelaide Festival leader Julian Hobba reflects on Writers' Week controversy
item.description: As Adelaide Writers' Week went up in flames, Julian Hobba contemplated resigning as Adelaide Festival's executive director. He now says "we needed to trust the judgement" of the literary event's former leader, Louise Adler.

item.description: The Run Nation Championship will see two athletes run at each other, in a sport criticised for its head injury risks. Organisers argue the championship has been professionalised, and will grow to be as big as boxing.

item.description: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley experience high rates of preventable health conditions, hours of travel to receive basic care and limited support.

item.description: Teeth are one of the most visible markers of poverty: structural circumstances that are individually borne.
